title.native: マブラヴ オルタネイティヴ 第二期

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

title.native: マブラヴ オルタネイティヴ
マブラヴ オルタネイティヴ

alternative: War Princess of the Southern Seas

name.native: パウル・ラダビノッド

node.description: Representative director of âge at ACID Co., Ltd. and one of the founding members of doujin circle "relic" (now: âge). He's the creator of the successful visual novel Kimi ga Nozomu Eien, Muv-Luv and Muv-Luv Alternative. He also did mechanical design for the Muv-Luv franchise and wrote other side-stories related. His real name is Yoshida Hirohiko.
Twitter __Yukio Nishimoto__ is a Japanese director, animation director, episode director and storyboard artist.
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

__Residency:__ Hino City, Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Berklee College of Music (Department of Film Scoring)

[Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/evancall) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/evan.call.33) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0nMGbTpPx4b3h5fMG9CpWJ) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/realevancall)

JAM Project ("JAM" standing for "Japan Animationsong Makers") is an anime music genre (or anison) "supergroup" based in Japan, originally founded on July 19, 2000 by famous 1970s theme song artist Ichirou Mizuki. The group is composed of many vocal artists well known in the genre; aside from the many anime and video game theme songs that this group has performed together, each member is famous for their own solo performances of anime-related music.  As a group, they are perhaps best known for their themes for the Super Robot Wars series of video games.

Her involvement in the game and anime Kimi ga Nozomu Eien, where she voiced the role of one of the heroines, Haruka Suzumiya and performed and penned the theme songs and other songs relating to the series, has brought her much attention. Her single "Precious Memories", used as the opening theme song for the series' animated version was a success; it had a peak ranking of 17th place on the Oricon charts and charted for 13 weeks.[1] She has since performed songs for other games and anime, including series such as Muv-Luv, Chrono Crusade, My-HiME, My-Otome, and School Days.    Kuribayashi has performed as part of the group Wild 3nin Musume, whose other present members are Joy Max (a.k.a. Joy Max Maximum) and Kisho Taniyama (a.k.a. Jackie Yang). She also once paired with Chiaki Takahashi to form the group exige, where Takahashi was known as CT. Veronica.(From Wiki)

**[Website (Kamitsubaki)](https://kanzakiiori.kamitsubaki.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kurogaki0311) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kurogaki0311) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv1KOiaRusvqOR4BrT9Sh8w) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@iori_kanzaki)**

__Introduction:__
__Iori Kanzaki__ is a Japanese Vocaloid producer, singer-songwriter and vocalist.

__Biography:__
In January 2014, he made his debut in Vocaloid-P by posting "[Hankouki](https://youtu.be/nYcSlZKyAD0)".
In 2017, the song "[Inochi ni Kiwarete iru.](https://youtu.be/0HYm60Mjm0k)" was released and has since garnered an impressive 24 million plays as of 2023.
Responsible for writing, composing and arranging all the original songs of the virtual singer "[KAF](https://anilist.co/staff/168254)".
April 2019 saw the release of his first album, "Hakushi," which featured a collection of his popular tracks.
In February 2020, he unveiled a special box set that seamlessly merged his passion for storytelling with his musical talents. This unique release included the first full-length novel, "Beast," along with the EP "[Life is Comedy](https://youtu.be/t-Ux4ccMCGE)."
In September 2020, "Ano Natsu ga Houwa Suru.", a substantially revised edition of the long novel "Beast" initially launched in February, was released by Kawade Shobo.
In June 2021, he ventured into full-scale self-vocals.
Following his first one-man live performance, the release of his second album, "Clumsy Man," followed suit.
The BOX edition of this release also included his new novel, "Shin'ai Naru Anata e," which was published in November 2021 by Kawade Shobo.
A manga adaptation, titled "[Ano Natsu ga Houwa Suru.](https://anilist.co/manga/159516)", based on his first novel of the same name, commenced serialization in August 2022.
In May 2023, after graduating from Kamitsubaki Studio, he launched his own label, Ikuru Shelf, to kickstart his activities.

[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfiSo8tO3WPU-8YOgr4Ba6g) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/vwp_virtual)

**V.W.P**, also known as Virtual Witch Phenomenon is a virtual singer group, signed under the label KAMITSUBAKI STUDIO. The group consists of:

- [KAF](https://anilist.co/staff/168254/Kaf)
- [RIM](https://anilist.co/staff/249497/Rim)
- [ISEKAIIJOUCHO](https://anilist.co/staff/273976/Isekaijoucho)
- [HARUSARUHI](https://anilist.co/staff/262530/Harusaruhi)
- [KOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/250353/Koko)

**[Website (Kamitsubaki)](https://kanzakiiori.kamitsubaki.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kurogaki0311) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kurogaki0311) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv1KOiaRusvqOR4BrT9Sh8w) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@iori_kanzaki)**
